intro: Eriogonum preclarum, commonly known as the Sierra dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its stems are often reddish in color. Eriogonum preclarum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is a common sight in alpine and foothill regions.
